alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Northwest Plateau; Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley; West Central Basin and Range; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 18 at 2:16AM MDT until April 18 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT TODAY FOR ALL AREAS BELOW SNOWPACK EXCEPT THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY, SANDIA AND MANZANO MOUNTAINS, AND NORTH CENTRAL MOUNTAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, VERY LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 10 PM MDT WEDNESDAY FOR ALL OF NORTHERN AND CENTRAL NEW MEXICO BELOW SNOWPACK DUE STRONG WINDS, VERY LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Today through Thursday will see a prolonged period of widespread critical fire weather conditions with strong southwest to northwest winds, very low humidity and an unstable atmosphere. Several consecutive hours of single digit humidity values expected today and Wednesday over eastern New Mexico and the Middle Rio Grande Valley with poor overnight humidity recovery. Widespread critical fire weather conditions will persist into Thursday with prolonged single digit humidity favoring areas along and south of I-40, but temperatures will be cooler than normal area wide. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 10 PM MDT WEDNESDAY... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 10 AM to 10 PM MDT Wednesday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Plateau (Zone 101), West Central Mountains (Zone 105), West Central Basin and Range (Zone 109), Upper Rio Grande and Lower Chama River Valley (Zone 121), Sangre de Cristo Mountains below significant snowpack (Zone 122), Northeast Highlands (Zone 123), Northeast Plains (Zone 104), Central Highlands (Zone 125) and East Central Plains (Zone 126) from noon today through 8 PM MDT this evening and from 10 AM to 10 PM MDT Wednesday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest to west 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 45 mph today. West 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 55 mph Wednesday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...6 to 12 percent, except up to 25 percent above 8500 feet each day in the Sangre de Cristo mountains. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Northwest Plateau; Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley; West Central Basin and Range; West Central Mountains
